DISTRICT LOTTERY – CONDUCT OF LOTTERIES (§ 14-2210) No later than seventeen (17) days after receiving a Notice of Availability forn Inclusionary Unit to be offered pursuant to a District lottery, theepartment of Housing and Community Development shall hold a lottery of thoseouseholds on the District List that meet the size and Annual Incomeequirements for the Inclusionary Unit as described in section § 2211.3. Unit size eligibility shall be determined based upon the following standards: Unit Size (Bedroom) Minimum Number of Persons in Unit Maximum Number of Persons in Unit 0 1 1 1 1 2 2 2 4 3 4 6 4 6 8 5 8 10 6 10 12 For each Inclusionary Unit, the Department of Housing and Community Developmenthall randomly select at least four (4) Households through a lottery from theistrict List. If fewer than four (4) Households on the District List meet theousehold size and Annual Income standards applicable to the Inclusionary Unit,he Department of Housing and Community Development shall hold a lottery fromhe Miscellaneous List in order to select at least four (4) Households whicheet the Household size and Annual Income standards applicable for thenclusionary Unit. The Households chosen shall then be ranked in the following order: Households residing in the District of Columbia, who shall then be ranked byhe length of time each has been on the District List; Households with at least one (1) member employed in the District of Columbia,ho shall then be ranked by the length of time each has been on the Districtist; and Households on the Miscellaneous List, who shall then be ranked by the length ofime each has been on the Miscellaneous List. If more than one (1) Household has been on the registration list for the sameeriod of time, their ranking shall be in the order in which the Households wereelected in the lottery.
